thread.title: Additional services from MBNA Thames Clippers during the tube strike
thread.title_full: Additional services from MBNA Thames Clippers during the tube strike

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: Additional services from MBNA Thames Clippers during the tube strike
text:
Additional services from MBNA Thames Clippers during the tube strike Additional services from MBNA Thames Clippers during the tube strike Details Category: Agency & Association   09:45 In preparation for the planned tube strikes on Thursday, 6 August 2015, MBNA Thames Clippers will be running an enhanced service during the morning and evening commuting hours. The strikes are expected to begin during the evening of Wednesday 5 August and last all day on Thursday 6 August before returning to a normal service on Friday. 
MBNA Thames Clippers will be running additional boats during the morning and evening rush hours on affected days, with a shuttle service running between Greenland, Canary Wharf and London Bridge. Services are scheduled to run every 10 â€“ 20 minutes. Historically, the service has come under considerable demand during major tube disruption therefore customers are asked to leave extra time for their journeys. The RB1 Commuter service and Greenland - Canary Wharf - London Bridge Shuttle will run on a first come, first served basis. Passengers on the RB6 Putney to Blackfriars service are strongly advised to pre-book their journey via the website and print out their ticket for travel. Related articles
